node.title: Traefik 1.3 ‚Äî Get Some More Raclette !
node.excerpt:
We released Traefik 1.2 only two months ago, and we are proud to announce that the fresh new Traefik 1.3, codename raclette is out!
As Traefik is getting bigger and bigger...
node.custom_excerpt:
We released Traefik 1.2 only two months ago, and we are proud to announce that the fresh new Traefik 1.3, codename raclette is out!
As Traefik is getting bigger and bigger...
node.meta_description: We released Traefik 1.2 only two months ago, and we are proud to announce that the fresh new Traefik 1.3, codename raclette is out!
node.plaintext:
We released Traefik 1.2 only two months ago
[/blog/traefik-1-2-morbier-is-out-8bc304a66ef3/], and we are proud to announce
that the fresh new Traefik 1.3, codename raclette
[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raclette] is out!

As Traefik is getting bigger and bigger, we decided to accelerate things and to
release more often. From a 4 months release cycle, you will now have to wait
only 2 months between each release.

The full changelog can be found here
[https://github.com/containous/traefik/releases/tag/v1.3.0] but here are some
new features we want to highlight:

Multiple Rules by Container
Thanks to Florent Benoit [https://github.com/benoitf], Traefik can now manage
multiple rules by container, introducing service labels
[https://github.com/containous/traefik/pull/1257]. You can now easily forward
multiple ports from a same container :) Here are all available labels:

traefik.<service-name>.port
traefik.<service-name>.weight
traefik.<service-name>.protocol
traefik.<service-name>.frontend.backend
traefik.<service-name>.frontend.entryPoints
traefik.<service-name>.frontend.rule
traefik.<service-name>.frontend.passHostHeader
traefik.<service-name>.frontend.priority
traefik.<service-name>.frontend.rule

Amazon DynamoDB support
Tskinn [https://github.com/tskinn] made a great job on integrating
[https://github.com/containous/traefik/pull/1158] Traefik with Amazon DynamoDB
[https://aws.amazon.com/fr/dynamodb/], a flexible NoSQL database service. You
can now push your configuration (frontends and backends) into this database and
Traefik will watch any changes dynamically.

Basic Authentication per Frontend
Another awaited feature, Manuel Laufenberg [https://github.com/santode] added 
basic authentication per frontend
[https://github.com/containous/traefik/pull/1147] configuration (it was only
globally configurable initially). Currently, Docker and Rancher backends are
supported, more will be added in the future!

Dashboard Filter
Ludovic Fernandez [https://github.com/ldez] added a nice little feature
[https://github.com/containous/traefik/pull/1437] in the webui: you now can
filter frontends and backends. When you have a big configuration with many
routes, it‚Äôs really handy to be able to quickly find what you want.

But that‚Äôs not all, check the whole changelog
[https://github.com/containous/traefik/releases/tag/v1.3.0] to get an idea of
the awesome work that has been done on this release. Lots of bugs have been
fixed and we have begun a strong background work on our CI infrastructure and
project quality in general.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Grab the latest binary for Linux, Windows, Mac on Github
[https://github.com/containous/traefik/releases/tag/v1.2.0] or get the official
Docker image [https://hub.docker.com/_/traefik/]!

docker pull traefik:v1.3.0 (or 1.3.0, v1.3, 1.3, raclette)
docker pull traefik:v1.3.0-alpine (or 1.3.0-alpine, v1.3-alpine, 1.3-alpine, raclette-alpine)

The documentation can be found on https://docs.traefik.io
[https://docs.traefik.io/].


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Following our $1M seed
[/blog/containous-raises-1-million-in-seed-round-funding-to-develop-traefik-f8238f47d2c7/]
, 4 new developers joined Containous [/] and are now part of the maintainers
team. We are thrilled to welcome Ludovic Fernandez [https://github.com/ldez], 
Attilio Borello [https://github.com/atbore-phx], Julien Salleyron
[https://github.com/Juliens] and Nicolas Mengin [https://github.com/nmengin] üëã
!

Traefik is still growing fast, we just passed 8k stars
[https://github.com/containous/traefik/stargazers] on Github and 7M downloads!


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We would love to hear your feedback on this new release. Join us on GitHub
[https://github.com/containous/traefik], Twitter
[https://twitter.com/traefikproxy] or on the Community Forum
[https://community.containo.us]!
node.html:
We released Traefik 1.2 only two months ago, and we are proud to announce that the fresh new Traefik 1.3, codename raclette is out!

As Traefik is getting bigger and bigger, we decided to accelerate things and to release more often. From a 4 months release cycle, you will now have to wait only 2 months between each release.

The full changelog can be found here but here are some new features we want to highlight:

Multiple Rules by Container

Thanks to Florent Benoit, Traefik can now manage multiple rules by container, introducing service labels. You can now easily forward multiple ports from a same container :) Here are all available labels:

traefik.<service-name>.port
traefik.<service-name>.weight
traefik.<service-name>.protocol
traefik.<service-name>.frontend.backend
traefik.<service-name>.frontend.entryPoints
traefik.<service-name>.frontend.rule
traefik.<service-name>.frontend.passHostHeader
traefik.<service-name>.frontend.priority
traefik.<service-name>.frontend.rule

Amazon DynamoDB support

Tskinn made a great job on integrating Traefik with Amazon DynamoDB, a flexible NoSQL database service. You can now push your configuration (frontends and backends) into this database and Traefik will watch any changes dynamically.

Basic Authentication per Frontend

Another awaited feature, Manuel Laufenberg added basic authentication per frontend configuration (it was only globally configurable initially). Currently, Docker and Rancher backends are supported, more will be added in the future!

Dashboard Filter

Ludovic Fernandez added a nice little feature in the webui: you now can filter frontends and backends. When you have a big configuration with many routes, it‚Äôs really handy to be able to quickly find what you want.

But that‚Äôs not all, check the whole changelog to get an idea of the awesome work that has been done on this release. Lots of bugs have been fixed and we have begun a strong background work on our CI infrastructure and project quality in general.

Grab the latest binary for Linux, Windows, Mac on Github or get the official Docker image!

docker pull traefik:v1.3.0 (or 1.3.0, v1.3, 1.3, raclette)
docker pull traefik:v1.3.0-alpine (or 1.3.0-alpine, v1.3-alpine, 1.3-alpine, raclette-alpine)

The documentation can be found on https://docs.traefik.io.

Following our $1M seed, 4 new developers joined Containous and are now part of the maintainers team. We are thrilled to welcome Ludovic Fernandez, Attilio Borello, Julien Salleyron and Nicolas Mengin üëã !

Traefik is still growing fast, we just passed 8k stars on Github and 7M downloads!

We would love to hear your feedback on this new release. Join us on GitHub, Twitter or on the Community Forum!

node.title: Traefik 1.2 Morbier is out!
node.excerpt: After 4 months of hard work, we are proud to announce a new release of Traefik: version 1.2.0, codename Morbier. The full changelog can be found...
node.custom_excerpt: After 4 months of hard work, we are proud to announce a new release of Traefik: version 1.2.0, codename Morbier. The full changelog can be found...
node.meta_description: After 4 months of hard work, we are proud to announce a new release of Traefik: version 1.2.0, codename Morbier. The full changelog can be found...
node.plaintext:
After 4 months of hard work, we are proud to announce a new release of Traefik:
version 1.2.0, codename Morbier [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Morbier_cheese].

The full changelog can be found here
[https://github.com/containous/traefik/releases/tag/v1.2.0] but here are some
new features we want to highlight:

Amazon EC2 Container Service
Thanks to Luke Petre [https://github.com/lpetre], Traefik now supports Amazon
EC2 Container Service [https://aws.amazon.com/fr/ecs]. This is a great news for
AWS fans who need more than an ELB/ALB to manage their inbound traffic.

Rancher
Finally, Traefik gets native Rancher support! Thank you Manuel Laufenberg
[https://github.com/santode]! It is now a lot simpler to have a specific
configuration backend right into Traefik.

Prometheus
A lot of people were waiting for it, thanks to Alberto Garcial
[https://github.com/enxebre], native Prometheus support is now real :) This
allows you to export internal metrics to Prometheus using a simple flag 
‚Äîweb.metrics.prometheus. More internal metrics will be added soon!

Netflix Eureka
Eureka [https://github.com/Netflix/eureka] is the service registry taken from
the Netflix OSS stack. Traefik now supports Eureka as a configuration backend
thanks to Julien Salleyron [https://github.com/Juliens]!

Healthchecks
Another long awaited feature, healthchecks are here! Again, thanks to Julien
Salleyron [https://github.com/Juliens]. A health check can be configured in
order to remove a backend from LB rotation as long as it keeps returning HTTP
status codes other than 200 OK.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Grab the latest binary for Linux, Windows, Mac on Github
[https://github.com/containous/traefik/releases/tag/v1.2.0] or get the official
Docker image [https://hub.docker.com/_/traefik/]!

docker pull traefik:v1.2.0
docker pull traefik:morbier
docker pull traefik:v1.2.0-alpine
docker pull traefik:morbier-alpine

The documentation can be found on https://docs.traefik.io
[https://docs.traefik.io/].


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In case you missed it, we just raised $1M
[/blog/containous-raises-1-million-in-seed-round-funding-to-develop-traefik-f8238f47d2c7/] 
:) You can expect a lot of new features in the coming months, as well as 
background work [https://github.com/containous/traefik/issues/1266]. Of course,
all this will be done involving the community as much as possible.

Traefik is still growing fast, we just passed 7k stars on Github
[https://github.com/containous/traefik/stargazers] and 3.5M downloads! The
maintainer team gains 2 more maintainers, Thomas Recloux
[https://github.com/trecloux] & Timo Reimann [https://github.com/timoreimann] 
üëã!


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We would love to hear your feedback on this new release. Join us on GitHub
[https://github.com/containous/traefik], Twitter
[https://twitter.com/traefikproxy] or on the Community Forum
[https://community.containo.us]!
node.html:
After 4 months of hard work, we are proud to announce a new release of Traefik: version 1.2.0, codename Morbier.

The full changelog can be found here but here are some new features we want to highlight:

Amazon EC2 Container Service

Thanks to Luke Petre, Traefik now supports Amazon EC2 Container Service. This is a great news for AWS fans who need more than an ELB/ALB to manage their inbound traffic.

Rancher

Finally, Traefik gets native Rancher support! Thank you Manuel Laufenberg! It is now a lot simpler to have a specific configuration backend right into Traefik.

Prometheus

A lot of people were waiting for it, thanks to Alberto Garcial, native Prometheus support is now real :) This allows you to export internal metrics to Prometheus using a simple flag ‚Äîweb.metrics.prometheus. More internal metrics will be added soon!

Netflix Eureka

Eureka is the service registry taken from the Netflix OSS stack. Traefik now supports Eureka as a configuration backend thanks to Julien Salleyron!

Healthchecks

Another long awaited feature, healthchecks are here! Again, thanks to Julien Salleyron. A health check can be configured in order to remove a backend from LB rotation as long as it keeps returning HTTP status codes other than 200 OK.

Grab the latest binary for Linux, Windows, Mac on Github or get the official Docker image!

docker pull traefik:v1.2.0
docker pull traefik:morbier
docker pull traefik:v1.2.0-alpine
docker pull traefik:morbier-alpine

The documentation can be found on https://docs.traefik.io.

In case you missed it, we just raised $1M :) You can expect a lot of new features in the coming months, as well as background work. Of course, all this will be done involving the community as much as possible.

Traefik is still growing fast, we just passed 7k stars on Github and 3.5M downloads! The maintainer team gains 2 more maintainers, Thomas Recloux & Timo Reimann üëã!

We would love to hear your feedback on this new release. Join us on GitHub, Twitter or on the Community Forum!

node.title: Containous Raises ‚Ç¨1 Million in Seed Round Funding to Develop Traefik
node.excerpt: We are proud to announce the closing of ‚Ç¨1 million in seed round led by Elaia Partners, 360 Capital Partners and...
node.custom_excerpt: We are proud to announce the closing of ‚Ç¨1 million in seed round led by Elaia Partners, 360 Capital Partners and...
node.meta_title: Containous Raises ‚Ç¨1M in Seed Round Funding to Develop Traefik
node.meta_description: We are proud to announce the closing of ‚Ç¨1 million in seed round led by Elaia Partners, 360 Capital Partners and...
node.plaintext:
Our CEO, at office headquarters after the closingWe are proud to announce the
closing of ‚Ç¨1 million in seed round led by Elaia Partners
[https://www.elaia.com/], 360 Capital Partners [https://www.360cap.vc/] and 
Kima
Ventures [https://www.kimaventures.com/]!

Based in Lyon, France, Containous is building Traefik [/traefik/], the next
generation reverse-proxy & load-balancer made to deploy microservices with ease.
In 2016, Traefik has reached more than 6.500 stars on Github
[https://github.com/containous/traefik/stargazers] and has been downloaded more
than 3M times.

With the help of our investors, our main vision is to release new cheeses more
and more often. We already bought a new factory that will double our production
capacity. After Traefik 1.0 reblochon and 1.1 camembert in 2016, you can expect
a lot more in the future!

Our release manager inspecting our main cluster> We believe this successful
financing round does not only provide us with capital, but also with stellar
partners that can help us take load-balancing to the next level. ‚Äî VP Product &
Sales
VP Product & SalesStay tuned for more announcements ;)
node.html:
We are proud to announce the closing of ‚Ç¨1 million in seed round led by Elaia Partners, 360 Capital Partners and Kima Ventures!

Based in Lyon, France, Containous is building Traefik, the next generation reverse-proxy & load-balancer made to deploy microservices with ease. In 2016, Traefik has reached more than 6.500 stars on Github and has been downloaded more than 3M times.

With the help of our investors, our main vision is to release new cheeses more and more often. We already bought a new factory that will double our production capacity. After Traefik 1.0 reblochon and 1.1 camembert in 2016, you can expect a lot more in the future!

We believe this successful financing round does not only provide us with capital, but also with stellar partners that can help us take load-balancing to the next level. ‚Äî VP Product & Sales

Stay tuned for more announcements ;)

node.title: Introducing Distributed Cheese: Traefik 1.1 Camembert Is Out!
node.excerpt:
After 4 months of development, we are proud to announce the second release of Traefik: version 1.1.0, codename camembert.
The full changelog is quite huge...
node.custom_excerpt:
After 4 months of development, we are proud to announce the second release of Traefik: version 1.1.0, codename camembert.
The full changelog is quite huge...
node.meta_title: Introducing Distributed Cheese: Traefik 1.1 Camembert Is Out!
node.meta_description: After 4 months of development, we are proud to announce the second release of Traefik: version 1.1.0, codename camembert.
node.plaintext:
Camembert [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Camembert] cheeseAfter 4 months of
development, we are proud to announce the second release of Traefik [/traefik/]:
version 1.1.0, codename camembert [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Camembert].

The full changelog is quite huge
[https://github.com/containous/traefik/releases/tag/v1.1.0] but here are some
new features we want to highlight:

Swarm mode support
In v1.12, Docker introduced swarm mode [https://docs.docker.com/engine/swarm/],
for natively managing a cluster of Docker engines. Traefik is now able to
connect to a swarm manager and will discover all services deployed on the swarm.
Thank you diegofernandes [https://github.com/diegofernandes] for your work :)

Constraints
samber [https://github.com/samber] initiated the addition of constraints, that
limits Traefik scope to a smaller number of routes. It allows to easily deploy
multiple instances with specific roles.
Let‚Äôs give an example and add this line to our TOML configurations:

# traefik instance 1
constraints = [‚Äútag==eu-*‚Äù, ‚Äútag==asia-*‚Äù]

# traefik instance 2
constraints = [‚Äútag==us-*‚Äù]

The instance 1 will now route services tagged with eu-* or asia-* (i.e. 
eu-backend, eu-frontend, asia-data‚Ä¶) and the instance 2, services tagged with 
us-*.
You can use Docker labels, Marathon labels or Consul Catalog tags to tag your
services. For example, let‚Äôs deploy a new Docker application and tag it:

docker run -d -l traefik.tags=eu-frontend emilevauge/whoami


This application will be taken into account by traefik instance 1 and ignored by
instance 2.

Mesos backend
PierreLeresteux [https://github.com/PierreLeresteux] & skydjol
[https://github.com/skydjol] made a great pull request adding universal Mesos
support to Traefik. In addition to Marathon
[https://mesosphere.github.io/marathon/], Traefik can now be used with any Mesos
framework (i.e. Chronos, Aurora, custom‚Ä¶). And yeah, the v1.1 codename is 
camembert because of those Normans [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Normans] guys!

Why not Saint-Nectaire
[https://github.com/containous/traefik/pull/353#issuecomment-233914436]?Session
affinity
Long awaited [https://github.com/containous/traefik/issues/5#issue-107706542] 
sticky sessions are now supported thanks to owen [https://github.com/owen]! Use
them with caution [https://12factor.net/processes] ;)

Cluster mode (experimental)
Traefik now has a cluster mode, which allows to deploy multiple instances
sharing the same configuration. To do that without copying the same
configuration file on each instance, Traefik uses a distributed Key-Value store
(Etcd, Consul supported). What is great with cluster mode is that it works with
Let‚Äôs Encrypt, using the Key-Value database to store the TLS certificates. 
Cluster mode [https://docs.traefik.io/] is available in this release as an
experimental feature.

Official Alpine image
In addition to the official ‚Äúfrom scratch‚Äù Docker image, there is now an
official Alpine image tagged v1.1.0-alpine, camembert-alpine. This can be useful
to get a shell access to a Traefik container for debugging purpose.

Experimental builds
For those who want to test bleeding edge features, we introduced experimental
builds. Each time a pull request is merged into master branch, a docker image
will be pushed at:

containous/traefik:experimental

A specific PR image will also be pushed at:

containous/traefik:pr-#


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Grab the latest binary for Linux, Windows, Mac on Github
[https://github.com/containous/traefik/releases/tag/v1.1.0] or get the official
Docker image [https://hub.docker.com/_/traefik/]!

docker pull traefik:v1.1.0
docker pull traefik:v1.1.0-alpine
docker pull traefik:camembert
docker pull traefik:camembert-alpine

The documentation can be found on http://docs.traefik.io
[https://docs.traefik.io/].


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Finally, we are very pleased to announce that dtomcej
[https://github.com/dtomcej] and SantoDE [https://github.com/SantoDE] just
joined the maintainers team. Welcome on board!


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We would love to hear your feedback on this new release. Join us on GitHub
[https://github.com/containous/traefik], Twitter
[https://twitter.com/traefikproxy] or on the Community Forum
[https://community.containo.us]!


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Edit 12/29/2016:
We just pushed the first bug-fix release v1.1.1 which deals with Kubernetes and
Swarm connection issues. The full changelog can be found here
[https://github.com/containous/traefik/releases/tag/v1.1.1].
node.html:
After 4 months of development, we are proud to announce the second release of Traefik: version 1.1.0, codename camembert.

The full changelog is quite huge but here are some new features we want to highlight:

Swarm mode support

In v1.12, Docker introduced swarm mode, for natively managing a cluster of Docker engines. Traefik is now able to connect to a swarm manager and will discover all services deployed on the swarm. Thank you diegofernandes for your work :)

Constraints

samber initiated the addition of constraints, that limits Traefik scope to a smaller number of routes. It allows to easily deploy multiple instances with specific roles.
Let‚Äôs give an example and add this line to our TOML configurations:

# traefik instance 1
constraints = [‚Äútag==eu-*‚Äù, ‚Äútag==asia-*‚Äù]

# traefik instance 2
constraints = [‚Äútag==us-*‚Äù]

The instance 1 will now route services tagged with eu-* or asia-* (i.e. eu-backend, eu-frontend, asia-data‚Ä¶) and the instance 2, services tagged with us-*.
You can use Docker labels, Marathon labels or Consul Catalog tags to tag your services. For example, let‚Äôs deploy a new Docker application and tag it:

docker run -d -l traefik.tags=eu-frontend emilevauge/whoami

This application will be taken into account by traefik instance 1 and ignored by instance 2.

Mesos backend

PierreLeresteux & skydjol made a great pull request adding universal Mesos support to Traefik. In addition to Marathon, Traefik can now be used with any Mesos framework (i.e. Chronos, Aurora, custom‚Ä¶). And yeah, the v1.1 codename is camembert because of those Normans guys!

Session affinity

Long awaited sticky sessions are now supported thanks to owen! Use them with caution ;)

Cluster mode (experimental)

Traefik now has a cluster mode, which allows to deploy multiple instances sharing the same configuration. To do that without copying the same configuration file on each instance, Traefik uses a distributed Key-Value store (Etcd, Consul supported). What is great with cluster mode is that it works with Let‚Äôs Encrypt, using the Key-Value database to store the TLS certificates. Cluster mode is available in this release as an experimental feature.

Official Alpine image

In addition to the official ‚Äúfrom scratch‚Äù Docker image, there is now an official Alpine image tagged v1.1.0-alpine, camembert-alpine. This can be useful to get a shell access to a Traefik container for debugging purpose.

Experimental builds

For those who want to test bleeding edge features, we introduced experimental builds. Each time a pull request is merged into master branch, a docker image will be pushed at:

containous/traefik:experimental

A specific PR image will also be pushed at:

containous/traefik:pr-#

Grab the latest binary for Linux, Windows, Mac on Github or get the official Docker image!

docker pull traefik:v1.1.0
docker pull traefik:v1.1.0-alpine
docker pull traefik:camembert
docker pull traefik:camembert-alpine

The documentation can be found on http://docs.traefik.io.

Finally, we are very pleased to announce that dtomcej and SantoDE just joined the maintainers team. Welcome on board!

We would love to hear your feedback on this new release. Join us on GitHub, Twitter or on the Community Forum!

Edit 12/29/2016:
We just pushed the first bug-fix release v1.1.1 which deals with Kubernetes and Swarm connection issues. The full changelog can be found here.

node.title: Traefik 1.0.0 reblochon is out!
node.excerpt: After ten months of development, we are proud to announce the first stable release of Traefik: version 1.0.0, codename reblochon...
node.custom_excerpt: After ten months of development, we are proud to announce the first stable release of Traefik: version 1.0.0, codename reblochon...
node.meta_description: After ten months of development, we are proud to announce the first stable release of Traefik: version 1.0.0, codename reblochon...
node.plaintext:
After ten months of development, we are proud to announce the first stable
release of Traefik [/traefik/]: version 1.0.0, codename reblochon.

> Tr√¶fik is a modern HTTP reverse proxy and load balancer made to deploy
microservices with ease. It supports several backends (Docker
[https://www.docker.com/], Swarm [https://docs.docker.com/swarm], Mesos/Marathon
[https://mesosphere.github.io/marathon/], Kubernetes [http://kubernetes.io/], 
Consul [https://www.consul.io/], Etcd [https://coreos.com/etcd/], Zookeeper
[https://zookeeper.apache.org/], BoltDB [https://github.com/boltdb/bolt], Rest
API, file‚Ä¶) to manage its configuration automatically and dynamically.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Here a some of the highlight features of this first release:

 * Single binary, fast, made with go
 * Docker, Swarm, Mesos/Marathon, Kubernetes, Consul, Etcd, Zookeeper, BoltDB,
   Rest API, file configuration support
 * Hot-reloading of configuration with true zero-downtime
 * Circuit breakers on backends
 * Clean AngularJS Web UI
 * Websocket support
 * HTTP/2 support
 * Let‚Äôs Encrypt [https://letsencrypt.org/] support (Automatic HTTPS)
 * Available on Linux, MacOS and Windows

A lot of work has been done to make this release: 237 Pull requests have been
merged [https://github.com/containous/traefik/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Aclosed], 184 
issues closed
[https://github.com/containous/traefik/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed], by 38 
awesome contributors [https://github.com/containous/traefik/graphs/contributors]
:

@jpillora @NicolasGeraud @KevinBusse @kumy @polds @janeczku @danzel
@Hugues-Antoine @ReadmeCritic @ProPheT777 @gbjk @jonaz @Russell-IO @sample
@s7anley @antoinecarton @wallies @pborreli @dontrebootme @kevioke @iadvizeponey
@PierreZ @tayzlor @dylanmei @stongo @fclaeys @tboerger @download13 @keis
@tooda02 @errm @advait @AlmogBaku @samber @cocap10 @ldez @vdemeester @emilevauge

I would like to give special thanks to @vdemeester
[https://github.com/vdemeester] who has been helping me maintaining the project
since the beginning, and @cocap10 [https://github.com/cocap10] for his great
work on staert [https://github.com/containous/staert] and flaeg
[https://github.com/containous/flaeg]. And we are very pleased to announce that 
@samber [https://github.com/samber], @errm [https://github.com/errm], 
@Russell-IO [https://github.com/Russell-IO] just joined the maintainers team.
Welcome on board!


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You can grab the binaries on GitHub
[https://github.com/containous/traefik/releases/tag/v1.0.0] or download the
official Docker image [https://hub.docker.com/r/_/traefik]:

docker pull traefik:v1.0.0
docker pull traefik:reblochon // if you prefer cheese ;)

The documentation can be found on docs.traefik.io [https://docs.traefik.io/].


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Reblochon is a French cheese made in the Alpine region of Savoie. Like all good
Frenchmen, we love food and especially cheese: it was obvious we had to call
every Traefik release with a French cheese name ;)


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We would love to hear your feedback on this first major release. Join us on 
GitHub [https://github.com/containous/traefik], Twitter
[https://twitter.com/traefikproxy] or on the Community Forum
[https://community.containo.us/]!
node.html:
After ten months of development, we are proud to announce the first stable release of Traefik: version 1.0.0, codename reblochon.

Tr√¶fik is a modern HTTP reverse proxy and load balancer made to deploy microservices with ease. It supports several backends (Docker, Swarm, Mesos/Marathon, Kubernetes, Consul, Etcd, Zookeeper, BoltDB, Rest API, file‚Ä¶) to manage its configuration automatically and dynamically.

Here a some of the highlight features of this first release:

  • Single binary, fast, made with go
  • Docker, Swarm, Mesos/Marathon, Kubernetes, Consul, Etcd, Zookeeper, BoltDB, Rest API, file configuration support
  • Hot-reloading of configuration with true zero-downtime
  • Circuit breakers on backends
  • Clean AngularJS Web UI
  • Websocket support
  • HTTP/2 support
  • Let‚Äôs Encrypt support (Automatic HTTPS)
  • Available on Linux, MacOS and Windows

A lot of work has been done to make this release: 237 Pull requests have been merged, 184 issues closed, by 38 awesome contributors:

@jpillora @NicolasGeraud @KevinBusse @kumy @polds @janeczku @danzel @Hugues-Antoine @ReadmeCritic @ProPheT777 @gbjk @jonaz @Russell-IO @sample @s7anley @antoinecarton @wallies @pborreli @dontrebootme @kevioke @iadvizeponey @PierreZ @tayzlor @dylanmei @stongo @fclaeys @tboerger @download13 @keis @tooda02 @errm @advait @AlmogBaku @samber @cocap10 @ldez @vdemeester @emilevauge

I would like to give special thanks to @vdemeester who has been helping me maintaining the project since the beginning, and @cocap10 for his great work on staert and flaeg. And we are very pleased to announce that @samber, @errm, @Russell-IO just joined the maintainers team. Welcome on board!

You can grab the binaries on GitHub or download the official Docker image:

docker pull traefik:v1.0.0
docker pull traefik:reblochon // if you prefer cheese ;)

The documentation can be found on docs.traefik.io.

Reblochon is a French cheese made in the Alpine region of Savoie. Like all good Frenchmen, we love food and especially cheese: it was obvious we had to call every Traefik release with a French cheese name ;)

We would love to hear your feedback on this first major release. Join us on GitHub, Twitter or on the Community Forum!
